issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: Signifies completion of tasks, info requests, etc.
resolution.name: Completed

fields.summary: Volume attachment fails for missing AXIS2C_HOME in CentOS 7

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
*Background:*

This cloud (Eucalyptus 4.2.2) has three clusters and one node in each cluster. Ceph monitor's port is missing in the NC's ceph.conf file.

Steps:
* Started an instance in cluster two and create a new volume
* Tried to attached the volume to the instance
* Volume attachment failed
{noformat}
2016-02-17 10:59:53  INFO 000004931 doAttachVolume           | [i-97c5f6fd][vol-f72dc0de] attaching volume
2016-02-17 10:59:53 DEBUG 000004931 doAttachVolume           | [i-97c5f6fd][vol-f72dc0de] volume attaching (remoteDev=sc://vol-f72dc0de, localDev=/dev/vdc)
2016-02-17 10:59:53 DEBUG 000004931 scClientCall             |  done scOps=ExportVolume clientrc=0 opFail=0
2016-02-17 10:59:53 DEBUG 000004931 connect_iscsi_target     | invoking `//usr/lib/eucalyptus/euca_rootwrap //usr/share/eucalyptus/connect_iscsitarget.pl /,vol-f72dc0de,vdc,euca-vol-f72dc0de-dev-vdc,virtio,demouser,/etc/ceph/ceph.client.demouser.keyring,/etc/ceph/ceph.conf,rbd,ceph,,,rbd/vol-f72dc0de,2a30faf7-ce69-4b84-8bf0-f78e4050e8a2,,,`
2016-02-17 10:59:53 DEBUG 000004931 connect_iscsi_target     | connect script returned: 1, stdout: '', stderr: 'Found rbd as protocol in connection string
Virsh secret already configured. Moving on
Monitor address and port information not found. Looking for 'mon addr = a.b.c.d:xyz' like configuration in the /etc/ceph/ceph.conf
'
2016-02-17 10:59:53 ERROR 000004931 connect_ebs_volume       | Failed to connect to EBS target: rbd,ceph,,,rbd/vol-f72dc0de,2a30faf7-ce69-4b84-8bf0-f78e4050e8a2,,,
2016-02-17 10:59:53 DEBUG 000004931 cleanup_volume_attachmen | [vol-f72dc0de] attempting to disconnect iscsi target
2016-02-17 10:59:53 DEBUG 000004931 disconnect_iscsi_target  | invoking `//usr/lib/eucalyptus/euca_rootwrap //usr/share/eucalyptus/disconnect_iscsitarget.pl /,,,,,,,,rbd,ceph,,,rbd/vol-f72dc0de,2a30faf7-ce69-4b84-8bf0-f78e4050e8a2,,, norescan`
2016-02-17 10:59:53 DEBUG 000004931 disconnect_iscsi_target  | disconnect script returned: 0, stdout: '', stderr: 'Found rbd as protocol in connection string, disconnecting is a no-op
'
2016-02-17 10:59:54 DEBUG 000004931 scClientCall             |  done scOps=UnexportVolume clientrc=0 opFail=0
2016-02-17 10:59:54 DEBUG 000004931 get_iscsi_target         | invoking `//usr/lib/eucalyptus/euca_rootwrap //usr/share/eucalyptus/get_iscsitarget.pl /,,,,,,,,rbd,ceph,,,rbd/vol-f72dc0de,2a30faf7-ce69-4b84-8bf0-f78e4050e8a2,,,`
2016-02-17 10:59:54 DEBUG 000004931 get_iscsi_target         | get storage script returned: 0, stdout: 'no-op', stderr: 'Found rbd as protocol in connection string, getting target is a no-op
'
2016-02-17 10:59:54 ERROR 000004931 connect_ebs              | Error connecting ebs volume sc://vol-f72dc0de,
2016-02-17 10:59:54 ERROR 000004931 ncAttachVolumeMarshal    | [i-97c5f6fd][vol-f72dc0de] failed error=1
2016-02-17 10:59:55 DEBUG 000004931 doDescribeResource       | Core status:   in-use 2 physical 8 over-committed no
2016-02-17 10:59:55 DEBUG 000004931 doDescribeResource       | Memory status: in-use 512 physical 16290 over-committed no
2016-02-17 10:59:55 DEBUG 000004931 doDescribeResource       | returning status=enabled cores=126/128 mem=15778/16290 disk=1139/1149 iqn=iqn.1994-05.com.redhat:b28ff629916
2016-02-17 10:59:55 DEBUG 000004931 doDescribeInstances      | invoked userId=eucalyptus correlationId=UNSET epoch=47 services[0]{.name=10.112.10.1 .type=autoscalingbackend .uris[0]=http://10.112.10.1:8773/services/AutoScalingBackend}
2016-02-17 10:59:55 DEBUG 000004931 doDescribeInstances      | [i-32a93126] Extant (running) pub=10.112.103.120 vols=
2016-02-17 10:59:55 DEBUG 000004931 doDescribeInstances      | [i-97c5f6fd] Extant (running) pub=10.112.110.23 vols=vol-f72dc0de:a
2016-02-17 11:00:01 DEBUG 000004931 doDescribeResource       | Core status:   in-use 2 physical 8 over-committed no
2016-02-17 11:00:01 DEBUG 000004931 doDescribeResource       | Memory status: in-use 512 physical 16290 over-committed no
2016-02-17 11:00:01 DEBUG 000004931 doDescribeResource       | returning status=enabled cores=126/128 mem=15778/16290 disk=1139/1149 iqn=iqn.1994-05.com.redhat:b28ff629916
2016-02-17 11:00:01 DEBUG 000004931 doDescribeInstances      | invoked userId=eucalyptus correlationId=UNSET epoch=47 services[0]{.name=10.112.10.1 .type=autoscalingbackend .uris[0]=http://10.112.10.1:8773/services/AutoScalingBackend}
2016-02-17 11:00:01 DEBUG 000004931 doDescribeInstances      | [i-32a93126] Extant (running) pub=10.112.103.120 vols=
2016-02-17 11:00:01 DEBUG 000004931 doDescribeInstances      | [i-97c5f6fd] Extant (running) pub=10.112.110.23 vols=vol-f72dc0de:a
{noformat}

* Fixed the ceph.conf file on the NC, so that it looks like below:
{noformat}
[mon]
  mon host = scale-03-10-02
  mon addr = 10.112.10.68:6789
{noformat}
* Restarted eucalyptus-nc
* Suddenly noticed that NC stopped reporting that instance in the log
* Tried to attach the volume again from CLC, this the it failed due to not being able to find an instance
{noformat}
2016-02-17 11:02:44  INFO 000018643 doAttachVolume           | [i-97c5f6fd][vol-f72dc0de] attaching volume
2016-02-17 11:02:44 DEBUG 000018643 doAttachVolume           | [i-97c5f6fd][vol-f72dc0de] volume attaching (remoteDev=sc://vol-f72dc0de,S2li6gX22lZC5onXoZiGs098jYI2VQGWefM9OuEz
KgccL5/LMsMwImjO7NOJB0jiC6b/GC6UpR2NAXEbC8jAh92RR+RY5xUauPLi4NJvjwurA46WVL/h6o2IHNY258d007YAJlF6Oi+KU86ZNitBqxBGBB/ySt2dadLLLfeDAFgEifRbjj6xSMHGnOfR3g4XbuYUYc5pMVll+FjUdzi/K2un
xhd6nJ0M8d6X9sXPimD7SnA6M1OCAJtGqsGvYhpVTZ0W1jLsL0/znNWh+Xx5GBcykTPsvsxd0nDuaQYk1+prZy2CXMNHcsodESJ1stmfLz7fg0PcL024lmhnxS0BOQ== localDev=/dev/vdc)
2016-02-17 11:02:44 ERROR 000018643 update_volume            | [i-97c5f6fd][vol-f72dc0de] failed to find instance for a volume operation
2016-02-17 11:02:44 ERROR 000018643 update_volume            | [i-97c5f6fd][vol-f72dc0de] failed to update the volume record
2016-02-17 11:02:44 ERROR 000018643 ncAttachVolumeMarshal    | [i-97c5f6fd][vol-f72dc0de] failed error=1
{noformat}

Virsh list still shows the instance:
{noformat}
# virsh list
 Id    Name                           State
----------------------------------------------------
 3     i-32a93126                     running
 4     i-97c5f6fd                     running
{noformat}

From [~jbreiding],
{quote}
So it appears this failure occurred in doAttachVolume on the NC on line 1473 of handlers_default.c, this means that the state of the xml from the update_volume call from line 1466 of the same file is likely the culprit.

This is likely easily reproduced if that ceph misconfiguration is reintroduced and the instance.xml from that instance would help to really understand why it barfed parsing it at startup.

But the failure in connecting the volume to ebs left the instance in a state of woe and nc at startup decided to throw it out with the bath water.

Adding some forced failure for negative testing to connectiscsitargetmain.pl would help identify this is also add to regression testing.

Also this failure has likely been in for at least a year now, just missed.
{quote}
fields.summary: NC fails to adopt instance in case of connect iscsi failure

comments.body:
This is a case of incomplete rollback/cleanup on the NC after a specific type of failure (connect_ebs() returns error response in [doAttachVolume()|https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucalyptus/blob/v4.2.1/node/handlers_default.c#L1442]). Note that the volume state on NC is left in attaching (represented by ‘a’) even after the failure. 

{noformat}
2016-02-17 10:59:54 ERROR 000004931 connect_ebs              | Error connecting ebs volume sc://vol-f72dc0de,
2016-02-17 10:59:54 ERROR 000004931 ncAttachVolumeMarshal    | [i-97c5f6fd][vol-f72dc0de] failed error=1
...
2016-02-17 10:59:55 DEBUG 000004931 doDescribeInstances      | [i-97c5f6fd] Extant (running) pub=10.112.110.23 vols=vol-f72dc0de:a
{noformat}

Volume information is saved to the instance.xml at the beginning of the attachment process. Due to the missing cleanup, the volume information continues to persist in the instance.xml even after the failure. 

connect_ebs() generate libvirt.xml content required for attaching the volume which is saved to instance.xml. Since the connect_ebs() failed in this case, there is no libvirt content to be saved to instance.xml. On NC restarts, logic to restore/adopt instances explicitly queries libvirt content in instance.xml and fails

{noformat}
2016-02-17 11:00:43  INFO 000018643 adopt_instances          | [i-32a93126] - adopted running domain from user AIDAAEG6HBWEJXUWDI54Y
2016-02-17 11:00:43 ERROR 000018643 get_xpath_xml            | failed to extract XML from /instance/volumes/volume[1]/libvirt
2016-02-17 11:00:43 ERROR 000018643 read_instance_xml        | failed to read '/instance/volumes/volume[1]/libvirt' from '/var/lib/eucalyptus/instances/work/AIDAAGVTSLEAEWOZDQM54/i-97c5f6fd/instance.xml'
2016-02-17 11:00:43 ERROR 000018643 load_instance_struct     | failed to read instance XML
{noformat}
Added more failure handling to help unwind during failures attaching ebs volumes.

The issue still exists.

{code}
